meanings.definition: Obtain (something) by devious or cunning methods.
meanings.sent1: He was wangling a free ticket to the concert.
meanings.sent2: She wangled her way into getting a discount on the dress.
meanings.sent3: By wangling a better deal, he saved a lot of money.
meanings.sent4: She wangled her way through the crowded room like a skilled magician.
meanings.sent5: The fox wangled a tasty treat from the unsuspecting rabbit.

meanings.definition: Manage to manipulate or control (someone) by devious or cunning methods.
meanings.sent1: The con artist was wangling money from innocent victims.
meanings.sent2: She wangled her boss into giving her a promotion.
meanings.sent3: He tried wangling his way out of doing his chores, but his mom caught him.
meanings.sent4: The puppeteer wangled the marionette with expert precision.
meanings.sent5: The sly cat wangled extra treats from its owner with a purr and a nudge.
